frameDefinitions: This frame concerns a Cognizer (a person or other intelligent being) paying close attention to something, the Ground, in order to discover and note its salient characteristics.
A Questioner asks a Witness (or defendant) questions in the context of a court procedure.
An Agent matches location with an Entity in order to fulfill some  Purpose.
This frame has to do with the bias or lack of bias of a Judge making an assessment concerning two or more Sides.
This frame contains items which, when manipulated, alter the function of some device, internal or external.
An Inspector directs his/her perceptual attention to a Ground to ascertain whether the Ground is intact or  whether an Unwanted_entity is present.
frameExamples: We <t>searched</t> the yard  for my contact lens.
We 'd like to <t>cross-examine</t> the witness if we can.
I ca n't remember how many times he <t>visited</t> ! DNI
This <t>button</t> makes the radio turn on.
The police removed Flonnory and Barbour from the automobile and <t>frisked</t> them for weapons.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Cognizer</fen> pays attention to an entity in order to discover something about it. The role is normally expressed as an External Argument:

The <fen>Cognizer</fen> pays attention to the <fen>Ground</fen>, so named because it serves as the background or context for the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>. This role can be expressed as an NP Object or as a PP Complement.

The <fen>Medium</fen> is the piece of text or work in which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> pays attention to an entity in order to discover something about it. The role is normally expressed as an External Argument:
An entity directed by the <fen>Cognizer</fen>  that interacts with the <fen>Ground</fen> to accomplish the scrutiny.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is scrutinizing the <fen>Ground</fen>.
The individual who asks a <fen>Witness</fen> questions.
A person who is present in a courtroom in order to give some form of evidence, has been sworn in, and is being examined by a <fen>Questioner</fen>.
When the examination occurs.
Where the examination takes place.
The sentient entity that is temporarily with the <fen>Entity</fen> in order to fulfil some <fen>Purpose</fen>.

The physical entity that is permanently associated with entities or characteristics that the <fen>Agent</fen> wishes to use for some <fen>Purpose</fen>.  During the visit, the <fen>Agent</fen> matches location with the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The time at which a visit is made.
A description of the position of the <fen>Agent</fen> during the visit.
This Frame Element marks the person whose objectivity in making assesment is being evaluated.
This Frame Element marks one of the <fen>Sides</fen> in a dispute or one of the alternatives in a situation of choice.
This Frame Element marks phrases jointly expressing both <fen>Sides</fen> in a dispute or all of the alternatives in a situation of choice.
The second-mentioned of the <fen>Sides</fen> to a dispute or alternatives in a situation of choice.
This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate how the bias of the <fen>Judge</fen> expresses itself in their behavior or actions.
The <fen>Dispute</fen> is the situation in which there is some conflict between two sides.
The individual whose point of view is taken in assigning the judgment denoted by the target.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part which indicates the character of the <fen>Decision_maker</fen>.
This role denotes the time when the partiality occurs.
This role identifies the entity or substance that is designed to have a particular <fen>Use</fen>. This is often an incorporated FE.
The person who inspects the <fen>Ground</fen> to see if it is intact or without blemish.
The entity that the <fen>Inspector</fen> inspects with his senses to ascertain whether it is intact.
An entity whose presence would impair the acceptability or usefulness of the <fen>Ground</fen>.

Some of the words in this frame occur with a constituent that expresses the desired outcome of the inspection.  Normally this constituent is a PP Complement headed by <ment>for</ment>, or a <ment>to</ment>-marked VP Complement.
The desirable state of affairs which the <fen>Inspector</fen> hopes to find to obtain when inspecting the <fen>Ground</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Inspector</fen> examines the <fen>Ground</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Chapter four</fex> examined the case for free speech.
The temperature controller monitored the temperature <fex>with a calibrated silicon diode</fex>.
You have leave to examine <fex>the witness.</fex>
<fex>The referee</fex> was totally biased against our team.
The umpire was partial <fex>to the home team</fex>.
The judge was neutral <fex>between the parties</fex>.
The judge favored the defendant <fex>over the plaintiff</fex>.
My sister remained neutral <fex>in our disputes</fex>.
He had a neutral <fex>smile</fex> on his face.
<fex>Smithers</fex> proof-read my paper on phlogiston production.
`Mister Thomas' said Holmes, `have you examined <fex>the lock</fex> to determine whether or not it has been forced or otherwise tampered with?'
Security guards frisked all the spectators <fex>for weapons</fex> as they entered the stadium.
Check all gutter brackets and clips <fex>to ensure no water will drip on to the walls</fex>.
Check <fex>that the light is out</fex> before you leave.
<fex>Yesterday</fex> we inspected all the taps and water pipes at animal enclosures being utilized

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Hellenic Ministry of Rural Development
